-1.title: Wild West
-1.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

1.title: Whiskey Rebellion
1.plot: The guys travel to Western Pennsylvania to explore the heart of the Whiskey Rebellion.

2.title: Oregon Trail Mix
2.plot: A visit to the ghost town of Chesterfield, Idaho.

3.title: Civil War Nectar Sector
3.plot: The guys dig at Civil War campsites in Virginia in hopes of finding strongboxes, which were once used to store valuables on homesteads.

4.title: The Lost Hotel
4.plot: A long-lost cavalry camp is sought in Montana.

5.title: The King and the Ring
5.plot: The guys head to Idaho's Snake River Canyon, where they return a wedding ring to its owner, visit the studio of a famous photographer and find a piece of stuntman Evel Knievel's rocket-powered motorcycle.

6.title: Diggin' the Cape
6.plot: The guys visit Cape Cod, Mass., in search of an artifact from the 17th century.

7.title: New Jersey, Old Nectar
7.plot: A visit to a Revolutionary War site in New Jersey.

8.title: Gold Diggers
8.plot: The guys help KG's mother find her lost ring. Later, they go prospecting for gold.

9.title: Hatfields & McCoys
9.plot: Artifacts from the infamous feud between the Hatfields and the McCoys are sought in Kentucky.

10.title: Cajun Gold
10.plot: The guys scavenge for gold coins in New Orleans. Their search includes stops at a plantation house and a home in the French Quarter.

11.title: Of Mines and Men
11.plot: The guys search for machine guns at Blair Mountain in West Virginia, where one of the largest civil uprisings in U.S. history took place in 1921.

12.title: Pirate Booty
12.plot: A search for pirate gold in southern Louisiana.

13.title: Gold Thief
13.plot: The guys dig for gold in Goodsprings, Nev., where they visit a 1900s-era mercantile store and find Native American artifacts.

14.title: Diggin' Lincoln
14.plot: A trip to Gettysburg, Pa., results in discoveries that include flat buttons and a used bullet. Also: The guys compete to find historic pennies.

15.title: Ghost Town Nectar
15.plot: The guys traverse the California Trail in search of personal artifacts from early American pioneers.

16.title: King of Rock n' Roll
16.plot: Rock-and-roll artifacts are sought in Mississippi.

17.title: Diggin' the Blues
17.plot: The guys search for blues-music artifacts in Mississippi. Included: a visit to the home of bluesman Muddy Waters; a stop at a sprawling plantation that once hosted blues concerts.

18.title: Tombstone Nectar
18.plot: The guys are in Tombstone, Ariz., at the site of one of the most notorious gunfights in American history: the O.K. Corral.

1.title: Billy the Kid
1.plot: KG and Ringy get exclusive access to hunt some of the most important Billy the Kid sites in the West.

2.title: Nuclear Nectar
2.plot: KG and Ringy look for parts of a nuclear bomb in Mars Bluff, South Carolina.

3.title: Bonnie & Clyde
3.plot: KG and Ringy visit John Wayne's birthplace and then check out the site of a Bonnie and Clyde shootout.

4.title: Bleeding Kansas
4.plot: KG and Ringy are hunting for artifacts from Bleeding Kansas, where the North and South first fought over the question of slavery.

5.title: Kentucky Lucky
5.plot: KG and Ringy are in Kentucky, visiting a legendary dueling tree and what could be the greatest Civil War sites they've ever hunted

6.title: Pirate Island Gold
6.plot: KG and Ringy dig for pirate treasure near the coast of Hilton Head, South Carolina.

7.title: Nectar Vortex
7.plot: KG and Ringy are in Glorietta Pass, New Mexico, looking for Kit Carson relics on the Santa Fe trail, as well as treasure from an eccentric millionaire.

8.title: Hannibal Nectar
8.plot: KG and Ringy are hunting the two scariest places in America: Waverly Hills Sanatorium and a notorious mental asylum.

1.title: Steve Jobs Time Capsule
1.plot: KG and Ringy are in Aspen in search of a time tube containing the mouse from Steve Jobs' first mass-marketed Lisa computer. The tube was to be unearthed in 2000, but due to changes in the landscape, its exact location was unknown--until now.

2.title: Fortress of Roundness
2.plot: The guys visit Pennsylvania, hunting for two forts from the Revolutionary War. Legend says that soldiers melted pewter utensils as emergency ammunition, but no one has been able to prove these existed. Can KG and Ringy bring this legend to light?

3.title: Mystery Coin
3.plot: KG and Ringy scour the playgrounds of America's rich and famous at the mansions of Newport, Rhode Island. They dig up an unbelievable find--a late 17th century artifact never before found in the Unite States.

4.title: Custer's Payroll Chest
4.plot: KG and Ringy are on an old-fashioned gold hunt in the Black Hills of South Dakota, looking for the lost payroll chest of one of America's most famous generals: George Custer.

5.title: Lost Nazi Plane
5.plot: KG and Ringy are searching for the greatest military nectar of their careers: a lost Nazi fighter plane that crash-landed in an Indiana cornfield. Finding an engine, wing or weapon from the plane would be the score of a lifetime.

6.title: Chasing Benedict Arnold
6.plot: KG and Ringy visit Maine, looking for Benedict Arnold's traitor possessions at Colburn House. Later, the guys head to historic Fort Richmond, where archaeologists have asked them to help uncover artifacts before the site is paved over forever.

7.title: Ammo in the Hole
7.plot: The guys head to Fort McKinley where the legend says that a cannon ring was buried here, and the guys are determined to find it. While there, they explore the haunted bunkers and uncover one of the biggest finds of their careers.

8.title: Sherman's March
8.plot: KG and Ringy visit Georgia to follow Union General William Tecumseh Sherman's legendary "March to the Sea." Along the way the duo dig up an artifact they've been looking for their whole careers.

9.title: Lincoln's Assassin
9.plot: KG and Ringy search for evidence left by the famed assassin: John Wilkes Booth. While scouring for clues, the duo finds themselves hot on the trail of uncovering the notorious missing pages of Booth's diary.

10.title: Wild Bill and Calamity Jane
10.plot: The guys head to Dodge City, KS to hunt a busy junction point on the Santa Fe Trail and explore downtown which was once home to saloons, brothels and gunfights and some of the Wild West's most famous lawmen: Wyatt Earp and Bat Masterson.

11.title: Wyatt Earp Wild West
11.plot: KG and Ringy are headed to the most wicked town in the Wild West: Dodge City, KS, which was once home to saloons, brothels and gunfights. It was also home to some of the West's most famous lawmen: Wyatt Earp and Bat Masterson.

12.title: The Lost Fortress
12.plot: KG and Ringy gain exclusive access to Rhode Island's Fort Adams, once the most heavily armed fort in America. The guys are hunting for treasure tied to Fort Adam's days as the U.S. Naval Academy base during the Civil War.

13.title: Grant Takes Vicksburg
13.plot: KG and Ringy are hot on the trail of Union General Grant's campaign to seize Vicksburg, a city of unparalleled worth during the Civil War. The guys are given the keys to three key sites to look for relics from one of our country's bloodiest hours.

14.title: Gangland
14.plot: The guys explore sites of the most notorious gangsters of the '20s and '30s. Outside Chicago, they search the home of Al Capone's right-hand man and one of Bugs Moran's hideouts, where he may have buried stocked slot machines.

15.title: Blackbeard's Treasure
15.plot: KG and Ringy head to North Carolina, hunting for Blackbeard's legendary treasure in three sites where the pirate spent part of his final year. This is their most challenging hunt ever but Ringy makes a find that's been on his bucket list forever.

16.title: Gold Rush
16.plot: KG and Ringy head west for one of their most daring digs, exploring three mines that produced a fortune in silver and gold during the prospecting frenzy of the 1800s. It's "Westward Ho!", and if they make it out alive, they may just strike it rich.

17.title: George Washington's Lost Camp
17.plot: The guys are hot on the heels of Braddock's retreat of 1755, trying to pinpoint exactly where Edward Braddock and George Washington's army set up camp. They hope to find military treasure in the lost camp, including the army's payroll gold.

18.title: San Francisco Earthquake
18.plot: KG and Ringy are at the site of one of America's worst natural disasters, the great San Francisco earthquake. They dig under the modern-day metropolis for historical artifacts that may help them to better understand what happened that tragic day.

19.title: Kentucky Bourbon
19.plot: KG and Ringy travel to the Bluegrass State of Kentucky to search for artifacts from two of the oldest bourbon distilleries in the country. They also hunt for a lost case of Prohibition era liquor that could be worth a fortune.

20.title: Pancho Villa Nectar
20.plot: KG and Ringy are on the US-Mexico border, on the trail of the notorious Pancho Villa. They're searching for conclusive evidence that a present-day golf course was once the site of a face-off between Villa's men and the famous American Buffalo Soldiers.

1.title: Butch Cassidy & the Sundance Kid
1.plot: KG and Ringy visit the Hole-in-the-Wall in Wyoming, on the trail of Wild West outlaws Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid. The guys look for items left behind from the gang's bank and train robberies during the 1800s.

2.title: Madison's Montpelier
2.plot: KG and Ringy are in Virginia, following in the footsteps of the fourth President of the United States, James Madison. Madison was one of the most important figures in American history, and the Diggers have been granted exclusive access to his historic homes - his estate, Montpelier, and his birthplace, Belle Grove Plantation - to look for artifacts that could help shed more light on the "Father of the Constitution."

3.title: Sleepy Hollow
3.plot: KG and Ringy are in upstate New York, digging deep into what's been called the first American horror story: "The Legend of Sleepy Hollow. " This part of New York's Hudson River Valley is the backdrop for the story partly because it's chock-full of Revolutionary War history -- and it was the real life horrors of the American Revolution that inspired Washington Irving's famous story.

4.title: The Ludlow Massacre
4.plot: KG and Ringy have been invited by the United Mine Workers of America to search for artifacts from the infamous Ludlow Massacre of 1914, when coal company guards fired on striking miners and their families. For more than 100 years, secrets of that day have lain beneath the ground. Now, the boys will look for important artifacts that could shed light on one of the most important days in the history of workers' rights.

5.title: Treasures of the Caribbean
5.plot: KG and Ringy are on the hunt for buried treasure in St. Croix, but pirates aren't the only ones who could have left behind riches on this small U.S. Virgin Island. The legendary Knights of Malta once ruled here. The boys could become legends in their own right if they can find any artifacts from either of these mysterious groups.

6.title: Grant's Landing
6.plot: KG and Ringy are in Western Mississippi marching in the footsteps of legendary Union General Ulysses S. Grant. While Grant's best known for land battles, in 1863 he pulled off America's largest amphibious assault until Normandy in World War II. And now the boys are looking for the spot where his troops came ashore.

7.title: Band of Brothers
7.plot: KG and Ringy are deep in the heart of Dixie, but they're not after Civil War nectar this go-around. They're digging for World War I and World War II artifacts from training camps and airfields in the South. The sites are all but lost to time, and the boys are fighting to preserve the history of "The Greatest Generation" and maybe find a buried World War I airplane!

8.title: The Real McCoy
8.plot: KG and Ringy are back in Eastern Kentucky on the frontlines of one of the most infamous feuds in American history: the Hatfields and the McCoys. The last time the boys were here, they made history by locating the McCoy homestead, and now they're back to join a full-fledged archaeology team and hunt for more feud nectar and settle a rivalry of their own.

9.title: Battle of Shiloh
9.plot: Shiloh, Tennessee: The Diggers are here searching for artifacts from the bitter surprise attack by Confederate soldiers on Grant's army, waged from the Tennessee River into Mississippi.

10.title: America's Deadliest Fire
10.plot: The Great Chicago Fire of 1871 stunned the nation, but few people know that the deadliest fire in U.S. history actually happened on that same day just 250 miles to the north -- in a little place most of us have never heard of: Peshtigo, Wisconsin. KG and Ringy are in Peshtigo where they've been invited to help shed light on the town's forgotten history by collecting artifacts for the survivors' descendants and the Peshtigo Fire Museum.

11.title: The Battle of Saratoga
11.plot: KG and Ringy are in Shiloh, Tennessee at the site of one of the Civil War's bloodiest battles. Our heroes are searching for artifacts from the bitter campaign of 1862 that was waged from the Tennessee River into Mississippi. They're hoping to shed some light on the lives of the brave soldiers who fought in these brutal battles.

12.title: Santa Fe Trail
12.plot: KG and Ringy are in the American Southwest, uncovering the secrets of the Santa Fe Trail. Back in the 1800s, the Trail ran through the wild towns in the West, and the boys are heading for one of the wildest. They'll also try to find a long-lost fort that helped keep the peace.

13.title: 12 Years a Slave
13.plot: KG and Ringy are in Louisiana, on the trail of Solomon Northup, a free black man who was kidnapped in the 1840s and sold into slavery. Solomon chronicled his ordeal in his autobiography, "12 Years A Slave," which was made into a movie 160 years later. No artifacts remain from his time in captivity and few from slaves in general, so the boys have teamed up with two of Solomon's descendants to help bring light to this dark time in history.

14.title: Captain John Smith's Virginia Nectar
14.plot: KG and Ringy are in Virginia's Northern Neck, following in the footsteps of one of America's first explorers, Captain John Smith. In 1608, one year after settling Jamestown, Smith set out with a small crew on back-to-back expeditions in hopes of mapping the Chesapeake Bay and discovering a route to the Pacific Ocean. Now, the boys have exclusive access to three sites on Smith's route that could be ripe with nectar, including artifacts from the legendary voyages.

15.title: Lewis & Clark's Montana Bonanza
15.plot: KG and Ringy are on the trail of some epic nectar right in their own backyard! They're in Montana following in the footsteps of Lewis and Clark, the legendary explorers who paved the way for westward expansion. If there's any evidence of their expedition left behind, our boys are determined to find it. Along the way, they'll also search for Twenty-Eight Mile Station, a lost stagecoach stop that hosted travelers from the headwaters of the Missouri River to the Pacific Northwest.

16.title: Nazis in Mississippi
16.plot: KG and Ringy are searching for World War II German artifacts in the heart of...Mississippi? Yes, it surprised us, too. But there were hundreds of thousands of German prisoners of war locked up right here in the U.S. In 1943, the US military started bringing German POWs to the United States to relieve the stress of housing them in England and North Africa. And the boys are headed to Camp Clinton, a major POW basecamp established in Mississippi.

imdb.plot outline: Hobbyist metal detectorists "King George" Wyant and his buddy Tim "The Ringmaster" Saylor travel the country looking for lost relics of history. They are invited by landowners, historians and archaeologists to go on a quest, and in their own way, a crusade, to unearth history that would have otherwise been forgotten.
imdb.title: Diggers
plot: Hobbyist metal detectorists "King George" Wyant and his buddy Tim "The Ringmaster" Saylor travel the country looking for lost relics of history. They are invited by landowners, historians and archaeologists to go on a quest, and in their own way, a crusade, to unearth history that would have otherwise been forgotten.::National Geographic
